right.value:
**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Get the text value of a XML. If the XML is a sequence, concatenation of the text values of the members of the
sequence is returned. If the XML is an element, then the text value of the sequence of children is returned. If
the XML is a text item, then the text is returned. Otherwise, an empty string is returned.
  
  
  
**Returns** `string`   
- Text value of the xml

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Change the name of element `elem` to `xName`.
  
**Params**  
- `string` xName: new expanded name

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Tests whether an xml value is a singleton consisting of only a comment item.
  
  
  
**Returns** `boolean`   
- true if `x` consists of only a comment item; false other

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Get all the items that are of element type, and matches the given qualified name, in an XML sequence.
  
**Params**  
- `string` qname: Qualified name of the element  
  
**Returns** `xml`   
- All the elements-type items in the given XML sequence, that matches the qualified name

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Returns a string giving the expanded name of `elem`.
  
  
  
**Returns** `string`   
- element name

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Remove children matching the given name from an XML. This operation has no effect
if the XML is not an element type XML.
  
**Params**  
- `string` qname: Namespace qualified name of the children to be removed

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Returns the content of a text or processing instruction or comment item.
  
  
  
**Returns** `string`   
- the content of `x`

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Sets the attributes to the provided attributes map.
  
**Params**  
- `map<any>` attributes: Attributes map

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Get the fully qualified name of the element as a string. Returns an empty string if the XML is not a singleton.
  
  
  
**Returns** `string`   
- Qualified name of the XML as a string

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Returns an iterator over the xml items of `x`
  
  
  
**Returns** ``   
- iterator object  
A character item is represented by a string of length 1.  
Other items are represented by xml singletons.

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Returns the target part of the processing instruction.
  
  
  
**Returns** `string`   
- target part of `x`

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Strips the insignificant parts of the an xml value.
Comment items, processing instruction items are considered insignificant.
After removal of comments and processing instructions, the text is grouped into
the biggest possible chunks (i.e. only elements cause division into multiple chunks)
and a chunk is considered insignificant if the entire chunk is whitespace.
  
  
  
**Returns** `xml`   
- `x` with insignificant parts removed

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.value_  
  
Tests whether `v` is read-only, i.e. immutable
Returns true if read-only, false otherwise.
  
  
  
**Returns** `boolean`   
- true if read-only, false otherwise

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Returns a subsequence of an xml value.
  
**Params**  
- `int` startIndex: start index, inclusive  
- `int` endIndex: end index, exclusive(Defaultable)  
  
**Returns** `xml`   
- a subsequence of `x` consisting of items with index >= startIndex and < endIndex

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Make a deep copy of an XML.
  
  
  
**Returns** `xml`   
- A Copy of the XML

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Remove an attribute from an XML.
  
**Params**  
- `string` qname: Qualified name of the attribute

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Applies a function to each item in an xml sequence, and returns an xml sequence of the results.
This represents each item in the same way as the `iterator` function.
  
**Params**  
- `function ((xml|string)) returns ((xml|string))` func: a function to apply to each child or `item`  
  
**Returns** `xml`   
- new xml value containing result of applying function 'func' to each child or `item`

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Tests whether an xml sequence consists of zero or more character items.
  
  
  
**Returns** `boolean`   
- true if `x` is a sequence containing only character items; false otherwise

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Searches in children recursively for elements matching the qualified name and returns a sequence containing them
all. Does not search within a matched result.
  
**Params**  
- `string` qname: Qualified name of the element  
  
**Returns** `xml`   
- All the descendants that matches the given qualified name, as a sequence

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Tests whether an xml value is a singleton consisting of only a processing instruction item.
  
  
  
**Returns** `boolean`   
- true if `x` consists of only a processing instruction item; false otherwise

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Returns the map representing the attributes of `elem`.
This includes namespace attributes.
The keys in the map are the expanded names of the attributes.
Panics if `isElement(elem)` is not true.
  
  
  
**Returns** `map<string>`   
- attributes of `x`

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Append children to an XML if its an element type XML. Error otherwise.
New children will be appended at the end of the existing children.
  
**Params**  
- `xml` children: children

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Tests whether an xml value is a singleton consisting of only an element item.
  
  
  
**Returns** `boolean`   
- true if `x` consists of only an element item; false otherwise

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Applies a function to each item in an xml sequence.
This represents each item in the same way as the `iterator` function.
  
**Params**  
- `function ((xml|string)) returns ()` func: a function to apply to each item in `x`

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.value_  
  
Returns a clone of `v` that is read-only, i.e. immutable.
It corresponds to the ImmutableClone(v) abstract operation,
defined in the Ballerina Language Specification.

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Check whether the XML sequence is empty.
  
  
  
**Returns** `boolean`   
- Boolean flag indicating whether the XML sequence is empty

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Returns number of xml items in `x`.
  
  
  
**Returns** `int`   
- number of XML items in `x`

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Check whether the XML sequence contains only a single element.
  
  
  
**Returns** `boolean`   
- Boolean flag indicating whether the XML sequence contains only a single element

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Get the type of a XML as a string. If the XML is singleton, type can be one of 'element', 'text', 'comment' or 'pi'.
Returns an empty string if the XML is not a singleton.
  
  
  
**Returns** `(element|sequence|text|comment|pi)`   
- Type of the XML as a string

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Concatenates xml and string values.
  
  
  
**Returns** `xml`   
- an xml sequence that is the concatenation of all the `xs`;  
   an empty xml sequence if the `xs` are empty

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Selects the items from an xml sequence for which a function returns true.
This represents each item in the same way as the `iterator` function.
  
**Params**  
- `function ((xml|string)) returns (boolean)` func: a predicate to apply to each item to test whether it should be selected  
  
**Returns** `xml`   
- new xml sequence containing items in `x` for which `func` evaluates to true

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Returns the children of `elem`.
Panics if `isElement(elem)` is not true.
  
  
  
**Returns** `xml`   
- children of `elem`

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Selects the elements from an xml value.
  
  
  
**Returns** `xml`   
- an xml sequence consisting of all the element items in `x`

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.value_  
  
Returns a clone of `v`.
A clone is a deep copy that does not copy immutable subtrees.
A clone can therefore safely be used concurrently with the original.
It corresponds to the Clone(v) abstract operation,
defined in the Ballerina Language Specification.

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.value_  
  
Performs a minimal conversion of a value to a string.
The conversion is minimal in particular in the sense
that the conversion applied to a value that is already
a string does nothing.  
  
  
**Returns** `string`   
- a string resulting from the conversion  
  
The result of `toString(v)` is as follows:  
  
- if `v` is a string, then returns `v`  
- if `v` is `()`, then returns an empty string  
- if `v` is boolean, then the string `true` or `false`  
- if `v` is an int, then return `v` represented as a decimal string  
- if `v` is a float or decimal, then return `v` represented as a decimal string,  
  with a decimal point only if necessary, but without any suffix indicating the type of `v`;  
  return `NaN`, `Infinity` for positive infinity, and `-Infinity` for negative infinity  
- if `v` is a list, then returns the results toString on each member of the list  
  separated by a space character  
- if `v` is a map, then returns key=value for each member separated by a space character  
- if `v` is xml, then returns `v` in XML format (as if it occurred within an XML element)  
- if `v` is table, TBD  
- if `v` is an error, then a string consisting of the following in order  
    1. the string `error`  
    2. a space character  
    3. the reason string  
    4. if the detail record is non-empty  
        1. a space character  
        2. the result of calling toString on the detail record  
- if `v` is an object, then  
    - if `v` provides a `toString` method with a string return type and no required methods,  
      then the result of calling that method on `v`  
    - otherwise, `object` followed by some implementation-dependent string  
- if `v` is any other behavioral type, then the identifier for the behavioral type  
  (`function`, `future`, `service`, `typedesc` or `handle`)  
  followed by some implementation-dependent string  
  
Note that `toString` may produce the same string for two Ballerina values  
that are not equal (in the sense of the `==` operator).

**Package:** _ballerina/lang.xml_  
  
Sets the children of `elem` to `children`.
Panics if `isElement(elem)` is not true.
  
**Params**  
- `(xml|string)` children: xml or string to set as children
